Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing well. I actually wrote that letter to my son.
That’s fantastic! How did that feel for you?
It felt really cathartic. I poured my heart out on the page.
That’s wonderful to hear. What did you write about?
I talked about my memories with him and how much I miss him. I also shared my hopes for the future.
That’s beautiful. Did you end up sending it?
I did! I found an address and sent it off. I don’t know if he’ll get it, but it felt good to send it.
That’s a big step! How do you feel now that it’s been sent?
I feel lighter, like I’ve released some of the weight I was carrying.
That’s a powerful feeling. It’s great that you found a way to express yourself. Have you thought about writing more letters?
I think I will. It’s a good way to keep my feelings in check and stay connected.
Absolutely! It can be a way to process your emotions regularly. Now, let’s talk about your job search. Have you made any progress?
Yes! I started volunteering at a local addiction recovery center.
That’s amazing! How has that experience been for you so far?
It’s been really fulfilling. I’m learning a lot and meeting some great people.
That’s wonderful. How do you feel about the work you’re doing there?
I feel like I’m making a difference, even if it’s just a small one. It’s nice to be in a supportive environment.
Being in that environment can be very healing. Are there any challenges you’ve faced while volunteering?
Sometimes I feel overwhelmed by the stories I hear. It’s tough to see people struggle.
That’s understandable. It’s important to take care of yourself while supporting others. How do you manage those feelings?
I try to remind myself that I’m there to help, not to carry their burdens. I also talk to the other volunteers about my feelings.
That’s a healthy approach. Having a support system is crucial. Have you found any coping strategies that work for you?
I’ve been practicing mindfulness. I take a few minutes to breathe and center myself when I feel overwhelmed.
That’s a great technique. Mindfulness can help ground you in the present. How has that practice been for you?
It’s been helpful. I feel more in control of my emotions when I take those moments for myself.
That’s excellent progress! It sounds like you’re becoming more attuned to your needs. Have you noticed any changes in your overall mood?
Yes, I feel more balanced. I’m not letting things affect me as much as before.
That’s a significant shift. It shows that you’re growing and developing resilience. What are some goals you have for the next few weeks?
I want to continue volunteering and possibly look for part-time counseling jobs as well.
That sounds like a solid plan. It’s great to have both volunteering and job searching as your focus.
I think it’ll keep me motivated.
Motivation is key. Let’s also discuss your writing. Have you been able to write more poetry since our last session?
Yes! I wrote a couple of new poems inspired by my experiences at the recovery center.
That’s wonderful! Would you like to share one of those poems with me?
Sure! I’d love to.
I’m looking forward to hearing it. Writing can be such a powerful tool for expression.
It really is. I feel like I’m tapping into a part of myself that I’ve neglected for a while.
That’s a beautiful realization. It’s important to nurture that part of you. Is there anything else you’d like to explore today?
I think we’ve covered a lot. I feel good about where I’m at.
I’m glad to hear that. You’re making great strides, and I’m proud of you.
Thank you, Ellie. Your support means a lot.
Of course! Let’s set a goal for our next session. Maybe you can share one of your new poems with me?
I’d be happy to do that!
Great! I look forward to it. Take care, and see you next time!
See you, Ellie! Thank you!
